title: Shasekishū
text:
The , also read as Sasekishū
, translated into English as Sand and Pebbles, is a five-volume collection of <a href="Buddhism%20in%20Japan">Buddhist</a> <a href="parable">parable</a>s written by the <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese monk <a href="Muj%C5%AB">Mujū</a> in 1283 during the <a href="Kamakura%20period">Kamakura period</a>.
It is best known in English for an excerpt included in "<a href="101%20Zen%20Stories">101 Zen Stories</a>".
The text makes mention of the <a href="Y%C5%8Dkai">Yōkai</a> known as the <a href="Nozuchi">Nozuchi</a>.
